pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw:
Your [other PR](#!/osrf/subt/pull-requests/367/model-submission-for-x4-sensor-config-8/diff) seems to cover 360 deg depth using a 3D lidar sensor, without the additional computing resources this would require. Can you explain the additional value provided by this configuration if the camera views are dark?  
Also, all of your PRs should target `urban_circuit` \(instead of `default`\).
content.html:
Your other PR seems to cover 360 deg depth using a 3D lidar sensor, without the additional computing resources this would require. Can you explain the additional value provided by this configuration if the camera views are dark?
Also, all of your PRs should target urban_circuit (instead of default).

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw: I have corrected this to target urban\_circuit
content.html: I have corrected this to target urban_circuit

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw: As far as the ring of rgbd cameras \(no lidar\), we are assuming that a camera like the Intel RealSense d435i is being modeled.  The stereo computation is done onboard each individual camera, so the compute resources should not be heavily changed \(I/O resources maybe\).  Also, they each have NIR emitters and are able to compute stereo even without headlights.  We thought about adding headlights around the vehicle, but ran out of time and wanted to make sure we had something submitted.
content.html: As far as the ring of rgbd cameras (no lidar), we are assuming that a camera like the Intel RealSense d435i is being modeled. The stereo computation is done onboard each individual camera, so the compute resources should not be heavily changed (I/O resources maybe). Also, they each have NIR emitters and are able to compute stereo even without headlights. We thought about adding headlights around the vehicle, but ran out of time and wanted to make sure we had something submitted.

content.html: I have added the example.ign and example.sdf world files.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw:
Due to time constraints, this configuration will not be incorporated before the code freeze. If you are interested in a similar capability on a UGV, the \[Explorer X1 model\] \([https://subtchallenge.world/openrobotics/fuel/models/EXPLORER\_X1\_SENSOR\_CONFIG\_1](https://subtchallenge.world/openrobotics/fuel/models/EXPLORER_X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1)\) has 4 RGBD cameras. 

Would you like to keep this PR open for consideration after Urban Circuit?
content.html:
Due to time constraints, this configuration will not be incorporated before the code freeze. If you are interested in a similar capability on a UGV, the [Explorer X1 model] (https://subtchallenge.world/openrobotics/fuel/models/EXPLORER_X1_SENSOR_CONFIG_1) has 4 RGBD cameras.

Would you like to keep this PR open for consideration after Urban Circuit?

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw: Yes. Please keep this PR open. Thank you.
content.html: Yes. Please keep this PR open. Thank you.

pullrequest.title: Model submission for X4 sensor configuration 3 by SSCI.

content.raw: This model is not expected to be incorporated for the Cave Circuit in favor of adding new robot models rather than additional configurations. Other 360-deg depth sensing approaches are already available that do not place a significant burden on RTF and additional 360-deg sensing options are expected to be added with the new robot models.
content.html: This model is not expected to be incorporated for the Cave Circuit in favor of adding new robot models rather than additional configurations. Other 360-deg depth sensing approaches are already available that do not place a significant burden on RTF and additional 360-deg sensing options are expected to be added with the new robot models.
